### Columbo Episodes Per Year

This is a basic bar chart that shows how to use group counts and a custom discrete range.

```{ojs}
Plot.plot({
  width: 1000,
  caption: html`Number of Columbo episodes per-year`,
  x: {
    label: null,
    domain: d3
      .range(
        d3.min(columbo, (d) => Number(d.year)),
        d3.max(columbo, (d) => Number(d.year)),
        1
      )
      .map((d) => d.toString())
  },
  y: {
    label: "# Episodes",
    grid: true
  },
  marks: [
    Plot.barY(
      columbo,
      Plot.groupX({ y: "count" }, { x: "year", fill: "#b59475" })
    ),
    Plot.ruleY([0])
  ]
})

```

```{ojs}
md`### Columbo Directors`
```

```{ojs}
md`This is similar to the above, but uses the Y axis for the discrete scale. It also makes space for the Y axis labels.`
```

```{ojs}
Plot.plot({
  width: 1000,
  x: {
    label: null,
    grid: true,
    ticks: 8
  },
  y: {
    label: null
  },
  caption: html`Columbo Episode Directors`,
  marginLeft: 100,
  marks: [
    Plot.barX(
      columbo,
      Plot.groupY(
        { x: "count" },
        { y: "directed_by", fill: "#b59475", sort: { y: "x", reverse: true } }
      )
    ),
    Plot.ruleX([0])
  ]
})
```

```{ojs}
md`### When did Columbo first appear?`
```

```{ojs}
md`This one is primarily intended to show sorting.`
```

```{ojs}
Plot.plot({
  width: 1000,
  x: {
    label: null,
    grid: true
  },
  y: {
    label: "Episode #",
    domain: d3
      .sort(columbo, (d) => d.columbo_first_appearance)
      .map((d) => d.episode_index)
  },
  caption: "When did Columbo first appear?",
  marks: [
    Plot.barX(columbo, {
      x: "columbo_first_appearance",
      y: "episode_index",
      fill: "#b59475"
    }),
    Plot.ruleY([0])
  ]
})

// columbo_first_appearance
```

```{ojs}
md`### tidy.js examples

These aren't charts, but they show how to use tidy.js (see the `import` at the bottom). It should make coming from R easier on the eyes and noggin'.`
```

```{ojs}
table(
  tidy(
    columbo,
    mutate({
      run_time_minutes: (d) => (d.run_time / 60).toFixed(2)
    }),
    select(["title", "run_time_minutes"]),
    arrange(desc("run_time_minutes"))
  )
)
```

```{ojs}
columbo = FileAttachment("columbo_data.csv")
  .csv({ typed: false })
  .then((data) => {
    return data.map((row) => {
      row.season = Number(row.season);
      row.episode = Number(row.episode);
      row.episode_index = Number(row.episode_index);
      row.columbo_first_appearance = Number(row.columbo_first_appearance);
      row.run_time = Number(row.run_time);
      row.year = row.original_air_date.substring(0, 4);
      return row;
    });
  })
```
